publicwhip.spmotion: *S1M-2222# Maureen Macmillan: Gaelic-Medium Education—That the Parliament notes the critical situation facing Gaelic-medium education as a consequence of the current shortage of Gaelic teachers; further notes the continuing shortage of university graduates intending to enter Gaelic-medium teaching, and urges the Scottish Executive to put into place without further delay (a) a review, update and implementation of the recommendations contained in Commun na Gaidhlig’s proposed national policy for Gaelic Education, Framework for Growth, which was submitted to the Scottish Office in 1997 and (b) the recommendations contained in the report by the General Teaching Council for Scotland Teaching in Gaelic-medium Education – recommendations for change which was submitted to the Scottish Executive in 1999. Note: The member who lodged this motion has provided the following translation –
S1M-2222# Gaelic-Medium Education (lodged on 14 September 2001) Tommy Sheridan*, Christine Grahame*, Donald Gorrie*
S1M-2222# Gaelic-Medium Education (lodged on 14 September 2001) Mr Jamie Stone*, Mr John Farquhar Munro*, Brian Fitzpatrick*, Dr Sylvia Jackson*
S1M-2222# Gaelic-Medium Education (lodged on 14 September 2001) Cathy Peattie*, Michael Russell*, Rhoda Grant*

S1M-2222# Maureen Macmillan: Gaelic-Medium Education-That the Parliament notes the critical situation facing Gaelic-medium education as a consequence of the current shortage of Gaelic teachers; further notes the continuing shortage of university graduates intending to enter Gaelic-medium teaching, and urges the Scottish Executive to put into place without further delay (a) a review, update and implementation of the recommendations contained in Commun na Gaidhlig's proposed national policy for Gaelic Education, Framework for Growth, which was submitted to the Scottish Office in 1997 and (b) the recommendations contained in the report by the General Teaching Council for Scotland Teaching in Gaelic-medium Education - recommendations for change which was submitted to the Scottish Executive in 1999. Note: The member who lodged this motion has provided the following translation - Foghlam tro Mheadhan na Gàidhlig - Gu bheil a Phàrlamaid a' toirt fa-near an suidheachadh èiginneach anns a bheil foghlam tro mheadhan na Gàidhlig air sàilleibh gainne luchd-teagaisg le Gàidhlig; a' toirt fa-near cuideachd a' ghainne de cheumnaich bho oilthighean a tha am beachd a dhol a-steach airson teagasg tro mheadhan na Gàidhlig, agus a' cur ìmpidh air Riaghaltas na h-Alba na leanas a chur an cèill gun dàil (a) sgrùdadh, cunntas as ùr agus buileachadh air na molaidhean a bh' anns an aithisg aig Commun na Gàidhlig a thaobh poileasaidh nàiseanta airson Foghlam Gàidhlig, Innleachd airson Adhartais, a chaidh a chur gu Oifis na h-Alba ann an 1997 agus (b) na molaidhean a bh' anns an aithisg aig Comhairle Teagaisg Choitcheann na h-Alba, Teagasg ann am Foghlam tro Mheadhan na Gàidhlig - molaidhean leasachaidh, a chaidh a chur gu Riaghaltas na h-Alba ann an 1999. Supported by: Tommy Sheridan, Christine Grahame, Donald Gorrie, Mr Jamie Stone, John Farquhar Munro, Brian Fitzpatrick, Dr Sylvia Jackson, Cathy Peattie, Michael Russell, Rhoda Grant
S1M-2222# Gaelic-Medium Education (lodged on 14 September 2001) Alex Neil*
S1M-2222# Gaelic-Medium Education (lodged on 14 September 2001) Cathy Jamieson*, Cathie Craigie*
